item.title: Krishan add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "We know enough at this moment to say that the God of Abraham is not only unworthy of the immensity of creation; he is unworthy even of man." -- Sam Harris

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "Man is manifestly not the measure of all things. This universe is shot through with mystery. The very fact of its being, and of our own, is a mystery absolute, and the only miracle worthy of the name." -- Sam Harris

item.title: Krishan add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description:
"The Ogre does what ogres can, Deeds quite impossible for Man, But one prize is beyond his reach: The Ogre cannot master speech.
About a subjugated plain, Among it's desperate and slain, The Ogre stalks with hands on hips, While drivel gushes from his lips." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Krishan add a quote by David Hume
item.description: "The truth springs from arguments amongst friends." -- David Hume

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "Colorless green ideas sleep furiously." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "Everybody does have a book in them, but in most cases that's where it should stay." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "The Postmodernists' tyranny wears people down by boredom and semi-literate prose." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Krishan add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "To see what is in front of oneâ€™s nose needs a constant struggle." -- George Orwell

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description:
"It's been suggested that if the super-naturalists really had the powers they claim, they'd win the lottery every week. I prefer to point out that they could also win a Nobel Prize for discovering fundamental physical forces hitherto unknown to science. Either way, why are they wasting their talents doing party turns on television?
By all means let's be open-minded, but not so open-minded that our brains drop out." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Blinding ignorance does mislead us. O! Wretched mortals, open your eyes!" -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "All sciences are vain and full of errors that are not born of Experience, the mother of all Knowledge." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Salvador Dali
item.description: "Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it." -- Salvador Dali

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Salvador Dali
item.description: "At the age of six I wanted to be a cook. At seven I wanted to be Napoleon. And my ambition has been growing steadily ever since." -- Salvador Dali

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Rosa Luxemburg
item.description:
"Freiheit ist immer die Freiheit des Andersdenkenden
Freedom is always, and exclusively, freedom for the one who thinks differently." -- Rosa Luxemburg

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Epicurus
item.description: "Is God willing to prevent evil, but not able? Then he is not omnipotent. Is he able, but not willing? Then he is malevolent. Is he both able and willing? Then whence cometh evil? Is he neither able nor willing? Then why call him God?" -- Epicurus

item.title: Krishan add a quote by James Oberg
item.description: "Keep an open mind, but no so open that your brains fall out" -- James Oberg

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "To understand just one life you have to swallow the world ... do you wonder, then, that I was a heavy child?" -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Krishan add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "When the New York Times scratches its head, get ready for total baldness as you tear out your hair." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Krishan add a quote by R.G. Collingwood
item.description: "The chief business of twentieth-century philosopy is to reckon with twentieth-century history." -- R.G. Collingwood
